document_data.mainbody: '''Pearls''' were not mined, they were the product of [[oyster]]s or other mollusks, but they were treated like gemstones.
document_data.Description:
Pearls were formed of layers of [[tchazar]] ([[wikipedia:en:aragonite|aragonite]]) around a bit of grit or other irritant, growing inside a mollusk over the span of a few years. This slow process gave pearls a smooth surface with a deep, rich luster.

Over-sized pearls {{SI|3|in|c|long=yes}} were frequently flawed in some way and not as valuable. One exception to this was a perfect head-sized pearl that was enchanted to become a ''[[crystal ball]]''. depending on market value.

Notable Users of Pearls.Magic:
* Pearls were used as a [[material component]] in many [[spell]]s, particularly those that reduced acids to plain water, and ''[[neutralize poison]]''. Crushed to a powder, pearls were used in creating all types of magic mirrors. Well-known magical items included the ''[[pearl of power]]'', the ''[[pearl of the sirines]]'' and the ''[[pearl of wisdom]]''.
*  Pearls were used to create ''[[periapt of wisdom|periapts of wisdom]]'', common magical amulets often found in possession of high-ranking clergy.
Notable Users of Pearls.Races & Sentient Creatures:
* Pearl was a common stone among the [[drow]], a gem worn by drow of average station, albeit they used only those of black, red, or deep mauve colors.
* The [[shalarin]] of [[Ser√¥s]] were known to craft [[pearl armor]] by transforming entire pieces of clothing into pearl using [[giant clam]]s.
